Fire Status: fire ignites near Big Creek, CA
Environmental Observations: Thousands of acres of dead trees in the Sierra Nevada Mountains due to drought and an infestation of the bark beetle acted as fuel for the fire.
Enhanced Fujita (EF)-1 and EF-2 category winds exceeding 125 miles per hour created fire tornadoes that accelerated the spread.

Action: Fire suppression combined the resources of the United States Forest Service, Sierra National Forest, California Department of Forestry and Fire Protection (CAL FIRE), the Fresno County Fire Protection District, and mutual aid resources. Fresno County issued an Emergency Proclamation. Evacuation orders issued to Camp Sierra, Big Creek, and Huntington Lake. Fresno county activated the Emergency Operations Center.
Evacuation Orders were issued for the entire town of Auberry, CA. ~200 hikers and campers evacuated.
Environmental Observations: Enhanced Fujita (EF)-1 and EF-2 category winds exceeding 125 miles per hour created fire tornadoes that accelerated the spread.

Action: Fresno Fair Grounds set up for small and large livestock
Animal Evacuation sites consolidate at Fresno Fairgrounds
Evacuations Orders and warnings are issued. Red Cross Established a Temporary evacuation point (TEP) at Granite Ridge Intermediate School.
Governor Newsom survey damage. Over 30,000 people in Fresno County and Madera County Evacuated.
Repopulation begins in many evacuation zones
Repopulation of all evacuation zones complete
Full containment of the Creek Fire achieved
